extendedIngredients.name: jalapenos
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound fresh jalapenos, halved lengthwise and seeded

extendedIngredients.name: monterey jack cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup (4 ounces) shredded Monterey Jack cheese

extendedIngredients.name: ranch salad dressing
extendedIngredients.originalString: Sour cream, onion dip or ranch salad dressing

extendedIngredients.name: sharp cheddar cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup (4 ounces) shredded sharp cheddar cheese

recipes.title: Pepper Poppers
recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a large bowl, combine the cheeses, bacon and seasonings; mix well. Spoon about 2 tablespoonfuls into each pepper half. Roll in bread crumbs.                                                                                           Place in a greased 15-in. x 10-in. x 1-in. baking pan. Bake, uncovered, at 325° for 15 minutes for spicy flavor, 25 minutes for medium and 35 minutes for mild. Serve with sour cream, dip or dressing.                                        Yield: about 2 dozen.                                                                                                     Editor's Note: Wear disposable gloves when cutting hot peppers; the oils can burn skin. Avoid touching your face.                                                                                                Originally published as Pepper Poppers in  Taste of HomeAugust/September 1998, p64                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             3 poppers (calculated without sour cream, onion dip or ranch salad dressing) equals 273 calories, 21 g fat (13 g saturated fat), 63 mg cholesterol, 454 mg sodium, 10 g carbohydrate, 2 g fiber, 12 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                    Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a large bowl, combine the cheeses, bacon and seasonings; mix well. Spoon about 2 tablespoonfuls into each pepper half.
Place in a greased 15-in. x 10-in. x 1-in. baking pan.
Bake, uncovered, at 325° for 15 minutes for spicy flavor, 25 minutes for medium and 35 minutes for mild.
Serve with sour cream, dip or dressing.
